Subjective: Sore throat x3 days; fever this morning. Started with cough last week, now resolved. Swallowing very painful, unbearable. Took paracetamol, ibuprofen this morning. Pain impacts daily comfort. No shortness of breath, no runny nose. No sick contacts. Had sore throat as child (ABX), few years ago (resolved). No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Concern: Abscess (friend had one). Request: Wants antibiotics for faster symptom relief.
Objective: Temp 38.3Â°C; Sat 98%. Ears: Left eardrum air-filled, no inflammation. Right ear canal slight redness, otherwise normal, no inflammation. Neck: Small submandibular lymph nodes, not pathological. Throat: Median uvula, slightly red pharyngeal arch. Tonsils slightly enlarged, not kissing, little slough bilaterally. No abscess suspected. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no additional sounds.
Assessment: Viral pharyngitis. No signs of abscess or bacterial infection.
Plan: Explanation: Likely viral infection, antibiotics not effective.
Symptomatic relief: Cold drinks/popsicles for throat pain.
Safety net: Contact if much sicker, shortness of breath, or unable to swallow properly.
